required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immunotherapy With BCMA CAR-T Cells in Treating Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Multiple Myeloma
clinical_study.official_title: Immunotherapy With BCMA CAR-T Cells in Treating Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Multiple Myeloma

brief_summary.textblock: This study is aimed to evaluate the safety, feasibility and efficacy of BCMA CAR-T in the treatment of relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a study to evaluate the safety, feasibility and efficacy of BCMA CAR-T in the treatment of relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma.
The Main research objectives:
To evaluate the safety and efficacy of BCMA CAR-T in patients with relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma
The Secondary research objectives:
To investigate the cytokinetic characteristics of BCMA CAR-T in patients with relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety: Incidence and severity of adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: First month post CAR-T cells infusion
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the possible adverse events occurred within first one month after BCMA CAR-T infusion, including the incidence and severity of symptoms such as cytokine release syndrome and neurotoxicity
Overall Remission Rate (ORR) including partial remission and complete

secondary_outcome.description: the copy number of BCMA CAR- T cells in the genomes of PBMC by qPCR method and percentage of BCMA CAR- T cells measured by flow cytometry method

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First month post CAR-T cells infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Cytokine( IL-6,IL-10,IFN-γ,TNF-α ) concentration (pg/mL) by flow cytometry method

arm_group.description: Patients will be treated with BCMA CAR-T cells

intervention.description: Biological: BCMA CAR-T; Drug: Cyclophosphamide,Fludarabine; Procedure: Leukapheresis;
